intro: Psychotria phanerandra, commonly known as the "Cape Cod" Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Psychotria phanerandra is also noted for its ornamental value and is cultivated in some botanical gardens.
